first_reading.title: Book of Jeremiah
first_reading.text:
[[Jr 33,14]]The days are coming, says the LORD, when I will fulfill the promise I made to the house of Israel and Judah.
[[Jr 33,15]]In those days, in that time, I will raise up for David a just shoot; he shall do what is right and just in the land.
[[Jr 33,16]]In those days Judah shall be safe and Jerusalem shall dwell secure; this is what they shall call her: "The LORD our justice."

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 25,4b]]Your ways, O LORD, make known to me;
[[Ps 25,4c]]teach me your paths,
[[Ps 25,5a]]guide me in your truth and teach me,
[[Ps 25,5b]]for you are God my savior.

[[Ps 25,8]]Good and upright is the LORD; 
thus he shows sinners the way.
[[Ps 25,9]]He guides the humble to justice, 
he teaches the humble his way.  

[[Ps 25,10]]All the paths of the LORD are kindness and constancy 
toward those who keep his covenant and his decrees.
[[Ps 25,14]]The friendship of the LORD is with those who fear him, 
and his covenant, for their instruction.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 21,25]]There will be signs in the sun, the moon, and the stars, and on earth nations will be in dismay, perplexed by the roaring of the sea and the waves.
[[Lc 21,26]]People will die of fright in anticipation of what is coming upon the world, for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
[[Lc 21,27]]And then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
[[Lc 21,28]]But when these signs begin to happen, stand erect and raise your heads because your redemption is at hand."
[[Lc 21,34]]Beware that your hearts do not become drowsy from carousing and drunkenness and the anxieties of daily life, and that day catch you by surprise
[[Lc 21,35]]like a trap. For that day will assault everyone who lives on the face of the earth.
[[Lc 21,36]]Be vigilant at all times and pray that you have the strength to escape the tribulations that are imminent and to stand before the Son of Man."

second_reading.title: First Letter to the Thessalonians
second_reading.text:
[[1_Th 3,12]]Brothers and sisters: May the Lord make you increase and abound in love for one another and for all, just as we have for you,
[[1_Th 3,13]]so as to strengthen your hearts, to be blameless in holiness before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his holy ones. Amen.
[[1_Th 4,1]]Finally, brothers, we earnestly ask and exhort you in the Lord Jesus that, as you received from us how you should conduct yourselves to please God--and as you are conducting yourselves--you do so even more.
[[1_Th 4,2]]For you know what instructions we gave you through the Lord Jesus.
